full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 16 of 247 144 LBUCmax1 Visoski - direct MS. COMEY: Thank you, your Honor. Ms. Drescher, could we please show this to the jurors. BY MS. COMEY: Q. While that's up, Mr. Visoski, would you please describe the ranch property that Mr. Epstein owned in New Mexico. A. The property in general, the whole -- Q. Yes, please, the whole property. A. The whole property. You started entering the ranch off of Highway 41 in Stanley, New Mexico. So you drove down a dirt road approximately a half mile and you would enter an area which the ranch called the Ranch Central, and that housed many buildings. Just to the left, there were two homes, and that was mainly for the ranch staff that lived on the ranch for support. So there were two homes to the left. To the right, there was a small office for the ranch. And then you continued, you're still in the Ranch Central area. And then you went still further into the ranch, probably a hundred feet. And then on the right side, there was a building that had rooms, there was approximately five bedrooms with a western motif on the outside. And that would be for whether it be, the -- any of the guests that would have came on the aircraft to stay, the chef, the pilots all still stayed there. And then it was a motel style building. And then across the street from that, there was a SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00011788
